summary.name: crimea.json
summary.dataset_description: A dataset containing information about the number of wounds, other injuries, and diseases recorded in Crimea between 1854 and 1856.

properties.description: The date on which the data was recorded.
The number of wounds recorded on the given date.
The number of non-wound injuries recorded on the given date.
The number of diseases recorded on the given date.

goals.question: What is the trend of wounds, other injuries, and diseases over time?
goals.visualization: line chart of wounds, other, and disease over time
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there were any spikes or dips in the number of wounds, other injuries, and diseases over the two-year period.

goals.question: What is the distribution of wounds?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the range of values for wounds and if there are any outliers.

goals.question: What is the correlation between wounds and other injuries?
goals.visualization: scatter plot of wounds and other
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is any correlation between the number of wounds and other injuries recorded on the same date.

goals.question: What is the distribution of diseases?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the range of values for diseases and if there are any outliers.

goals.question: What is the total number of wounds, other injuries, and diseases recorded over the two-year period?
goals.visualization: stacked bar chart of wounds, other, and disease
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the relative contribution of wounds, other injuries, and diseases to the total number of injuries and diseases recorded over the two-year period.

code:
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], format='%Y-%m-%d', errors='coerce')
    data = data.dropna()
    sns.set_style("darkgrid")
    sns.lineplot(x='date', y='wounds', data=data, label='Wounds')
    sns.lineplot(x='date', y='other', data=data, label='Other Injuries')
    sns.lineplot(x='date', y='disease', data=data, label='Diseases')
    plt.title('What is the trend of wounds, other injuries, and diseases over time?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['wounds'] = pd.to_numeric(data['wounds'], errors='coerce')
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='wounds', kde=True, color='blue')
    plt.axvline(data['wounds'].median(), color='red', label='Median: {:.2f}'.format(data['wounds'].median()))
    plt.legend()
    plt.title('What is the distribution of wounds?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], format='%Y-%m-%d', errors='coerce')
    sns.scatterplot(x='wounds', y='other', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the correlation between wounds and other injuries?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['disease'] = pd.to_numeric(data['disease'], errors='coerce')
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='disease', kde=True, color='blue')
    plt.axvline(data['disease'].median(), color='red', label='Median: {:.2f}'.format(data['disease'].median()))
    plt.title('What is the distribution of diseases?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], format='%Y-%m-%d', errors='coerce')
    data = data.dropna()
    data['total'] = data['wounds'] + data['other'] + data['disease']
    chart = sns.barplot(x='date', y='total', data=data, palette='muted')
    plt.title('What is the total number of wounds, other injuries, and diseases recorded over the two-year period?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
